p.seg: Beckler usually wrote his letters to his brother Carl over a period of time, adding to them as he went along; they thus form a kind of personal diary not only of what he did, but also his thoughts, ideas, daydreams, hopes and fears, his observations and experiences, descriptions of life in city and towns, of landscapes, etc.

div.p: [...] Vor ein paar Tagen erhielt ich einen Brief von Dr. Müller, Government Botanist in Victoria. Mr Woolls von Parramatta machte ihm wahrscheinlich ein einfältiges Geschwätz von mir vor, obgleich er von meinen Briefen aus mich besser kennen sollte. Der Brief freute mich natürlich, anfangs, bald aber machte er mir einen Moralischen, ich beantwortete ihn auch so, dass Dr. Müller nicht viel von mir erwarten wird. [...]

[...] A few days ago I received a letter from Dr Mueller, Government Botanist in Victoria. Mr Woolls of Parramatta probably made some silly remarks to him about me, although he ought to know me better from my letters. At first the letter pleased me greatly, but then he started to moralise, and I replied to him in such a way that Dr Mueller won't expect much from me. [...]
